name: Young Men's Christian Association of Pittsburgh Tax Case
name_abbreviation: Young Men's Christian Association of Pittsburgh Tax Case

judges: Before Stern, C. J., Stearns, Jones, Musmanno and Arnold, JJ.
parties: Young Men’s Christian Association of Pittsburgh Tax Case.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Pee Cueiam,
The judgment is affirmed on the opinion of Judge Haeey Montgomery of the court below, whose opinion is reported in 4 D. & C. 2d 186.
opinions.author: Pee Cueiam,

attorneys: Philip Baslcin, Assistant County Solicitor, with him Nathaniel K. Beelc, County Solicitor, and John G. Brosky, Assistant County Solicitor, for appellant.
William F. Knox, with him Moorhead é Knox, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Young Men’s Christian Association of Pittsburgh Tax Case.
Argued September 29, 1955.
Before Stern, C. J., Stearns, Jones, Musmanno and Arnold, JJ.
November 14, 1955:
Philip Baslcin, Assistant County Solicitor, with him Nathaniel K. Beelc, County Solicitor, and John G. Brosky, Assistant County Solicitor, for appellant.
William F. Knox, with him Moorhead é Knox, for appellee.
